member.name: D3D12_COMMAND_LIST_SUPPORT_FLAGS
member.summary: Used to determine which kinds of command lists are capable of supporting various operations. For example, whether a command list supports immediate writes.

member.name: D3D12_COMMAND_LIST_SUPPORT_FLAGS.D3D12_COMMAND_LIST_SUPPORT_FLAG_NONE
member.summary: Specifies that no command list supports the operation in question.

member.name: D3D12_COMMAND_LIST_SUPPORT_FLAGS.D3D12_COMMAND_LIST_SUPPORT_FLAG_DIRECT
member.summary: Specifies that direct command lists can support the operation in question.

member.name: D3D12_COMMAND_LIST_SUPPORT_FLAGS.D3D12_COMMAND_LIST_SUPPORT_FLAG_BUNDLE
member.summary: Specifies that command list bundles can support the operation in question.

member.name: D3D12_COMMAND_LIST_SUPPORT_FLAGS.D3D12_COMMAND_LIST_SUPPORT_FLAG_COMPUTE
member.summary: Specifies that compute command lists can support the operation in question.

member.name: D3D12_COMMAND_LIST_SUPPORT_FLAGS.D3D12_COMMAND_LIST_SUPPORT_FLAG_COPY
member.summary: Specifies that copy command lists can support the operation in question.

member.name: D3D12_COMMAND_LIST_SUPPORT_FLAGS.D3D12_COMMAND_LIST_SUPPORT_FLAG_VIDEO_DECODE
member.summary: Specifies that video-decode command lists can support the operation in question.

member.name: D3D12_COMMAND_LIST_SUPPORT_FLAGS.D3D12_COMMAND_LIST_SUPPORT_FLAG_VIDEO_PROCESS
member.summary: Specifies that video-processing command lists can support the operation is question.
